slo.name: User API Request Response Time
slo.description: Ensure that 95% of requests are responded within 200ms.

sli.name: Response Time
sli.description: The time taken to respond to a request.

sli.name: User API Error Rate
sli.description: Ensure that the error rate is below 1%.

alerts.name: High User API Response Time Alert
alerts.description: Alerts when the response time exceeds 500ms for more than 5 minutes.

alerts.name: User API Error Rate Alert
alerts.description: Alerts when the error rate exceeds 1% for more than 15 minutes.

explanation: The SLOs, SLIs, and alerts were derived based on common Service Level Objectives and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for a User API service. The SLOs specify the desired performance levels, while the SLIs provide specific metrics to measure those levels. Alerts are set up to notify when the specified conditions are met, ensuring prompt action can be taken to maintain service reliability.
llm_suggestions: Implement request tracing for better understanding of the end-to-end latency and error rate.
Set up proactive monitoring by analyzing historical data and predicting potential issues before they impact users.
